rev.comment: /* Statements regarding President Obama */ extended quote where experts connect the poll to 'birtherism' issue.
rev.diff:
Line 201: Line 201:
<!-- As the "birther" issue that he championed started fading with the release of President Barack Obama's birth certificate, which occurred on the same weekend as President Obama's historic announcement of the US military's successful capture and killing of international terrorist Osama Bin Laden, so did Trump's popularity. In what the survey shop Public Policy Polling described as "one of the quickest rises and falls in the history of presidential politics," Donald Trump plummeted from a field-leading 26 percent in the polls of potential Republican presidential candidates to a mere 8 percent, which tied him for fifth-place tie with the man he has often criticized as unelectable, Ron Paul. -->
<!-- As the "birther" issue that he championed started fading with the release of President Barack Obama's birth certificate, which occurred on the same weekend as President Obama's historic announcement of the US military's successful capture and killing of international terrorist Osama Bin Laden, so did Trump's popularity. In what the survey shop Public Policy Polling described as "one of the quickest rises and falls in the history of presidential politics," Donald Trump plummeted from a field-leading 26 percent in the polls of potential Republican presidential candidates to a mere 8 percent, which tied him for fifth-place tie with the man he has often criticized as unelectable, Ron Paul. -->
â
Public Policy Polling described the events as "one of the quickest rises and falls in the history of presidential politics".<ref>[http://publicpolicypolling.blogspot.com/2011/05/trump-collapses.html]</ref>
+
  +
Public Policy Polling described the events as "one of the quickest rises and falls in the history of presidential politics", saying:
  +
:''"Trump really made hay out of the 'birther' issue and as the resonance of that has declined, so has his standing. In February we found that 51% of Republican primary voters thought Barack Obama was not born in the United States. Now with the release of his birth certificate only 34% of GOP partisans fall into that camp, and Trump's only in fifth place with that now smaller group of the electorate at 9%"''<ref>[http://publicpolicypolling.blogspot.com/2011/05/trump-collapses.html]</ref>
